title: Security Analyst
description:
Position Title: Security Analyst

Reports To: Chief Information Security Officer

FLSA Status: Exempt

Salary: $65,000-$85,000


About the Company:

We live in a world where constant technological strides have significantly impacted every aspect of our lives. Vinson Group LLC is leading the way in the field of education technology. Our company combines knowledge and customer service to provide technology solutions to schools. At Vinson, we leverage our experience in the educational sector and beyond to help parents, students, teachers, and school leaders tackle the impossible daily.


Our goal as an organization is to invest in our employees to better the quality of education in schools and to give our employees the opportunity for a career path in IT. Learn from a wide range of equipment in different environments and learn from others’ technical diversity. To be successful in this role, you’ll need to be highly collaborative, an excellent troubleshooter, a superb communicator, and a team player. Are you eager to work for a company that values career trajectory, a positive environment, and making a difference in education? Look no further and apply today with Vinson!


What it’s Like to Work Here

Ask our employees, and one word they’d use to describe working at Vinson Group LLC is “great.” Our team members all share a positive attitude, problem-solving abilities, and patience, enabling them to provide excellent customer service. Our culture, plus continuous opportunities for growth, has resulted in positive working relationships. Don’t miss out on this job opening with us!


POSITION SUMMARY


The Security Analyst will work with the Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) to deliver the Vinson Protect service offering to client districts. This role will work closely with clients and staff to ensure operational tasks are completed and communicated internally and externally. As new clients are identified and procured, the Security Analyst will ensure all tasks are accomplished for a successful onboarding and service delivery.


ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES


Include, but are not limited to, the following:


Client Focus

Work closely with the clients and teams to meet all deliverables. The Security Analyst is the primary point of contact for Vinson Protect client requests and communicates with the Chief Information Security Officer and on-site staff as needed.


  • Develop action plans, set timelines, and maintain continuous communication to deliver the Vinson Protect service to client districts

  • Perform onboarding activities to configure Vinson Protect services for clients

  • Assist districts and schools with the installation of required software agents and configurations to effectively deliver Vinson Protect services

  • Escalate and communicate issues to the Chief Information Security Officer for follow-up

  • Ensure the overall delivery of the services outlined in the support contract developed for each client

  • Follow up and complete all client documentation and ensure it is updated throughout the year

  • Verify clients receive their standard operational reports

  • Prepare all standard reports and information to support client meetings


Company Support

Support company-wide initiatives with the Regional Director team to drive a positive company culture and the ability to grow/scale the company through standards

  • Work with Chief Information Security Officer, Regional Directors, and on-site staff to provide input/insights on company initiatives

  • Participate in Monthly Team Meetings and Quarterly IT Manager Training


Required Qualifications:


To perform this job successfully, an individual must satisfactorily perform each essential duty. The requirements below represent knowledge, skill, and/or ability.


  • ITCA, CC, CCRE, or equivalent Industry-standard certification in cybersecurity

  • Minimum of 2 years of information technology experience

  • Ability to think critically, problem solve, communicate, and manage task execution

  • Ability to strategically plan, organize, and establish priorities to achieve results

  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills to effectively interface with clients and senior management

  • Ability to work under tight deadlines while maintaining a high-quality level of work

  • High level of professionalism, ethics, and integrity, with the ability to build relationships while ensuring compliance with all company policies

  • Detail-oriented and well-organized, with the ability to effectively manage a high-volume workload

  • Able to handle sensitive/confidential situations and documentation

  • Growth mindset with a passion for new challenges, continued growth, and feedback

  • Strong analytical, interpersonal, written, and communication skills

  • Aptitude to troubleshoot and apply technical knowledge in unfamiliar situations

  • Ability to comprehend and follow verbal/written instructions in English

  • Ability to consistently present oneself in a professional manner

  • High level of discretion and ability to follow confidentiality protocols

  • Must clear criminal background check and drug screen


Preferred Qualifications:


  • CISSP, CISM, or equivalent Industry-standard certification in cybersecurity

  • Experience with deploying server- and workstation-based applications and agents using automated tools, including Remote Monitoring and Management (RMM) and Active Directory Group Policy Objects (GPOs)

  • Associate degree in Cybersecurity, IT, or a related field

  • 2+ years of educational technology experience

  • Experience working in a school or educational environment


Work Environment & Physical Demands

This job operates in a professional school environment. It routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets, and fax machines. The individual can lift up to 50 pounds.


Position Type and Expected Hours of Work

This is a full-time position; typical work hours are 40, Monday through Friday. Our hours of operation are 7:00 AM and 4:00 PM. We offer flexible schedules within this time frame to fit your needs. After-hours support may be required on an as-needed basis.


Travel

This position may be required to travel to support client operations, attend training, attend conferences, or attend meetings but primarily remote . Reliable form of transportation is required. Vinson reimburses employees at a rate of $.655 per mile after 40 miles of travel per day.


Compensation

Negotiable based on experience


Benefits for full-time employees

  • 401(k) after 6-months of employment

  • Health Insurance

  • Dental Insurance

  • Vision Insurance

  • 120 Days of Paid Time Off

  • 10 Paid Holidays

  • Life Insurance

  • Paid Monthly Team Lunches

  • Hours of Operation: Monday – Friday

  • Mileage Reimbursement

  • Company Phone or Personal Phone Reimbursement

  • Flexible Schedule

  • Being Part of a Team vs. Being a Number

  • Friendly Working Environment

  • Vinson is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Minorities / Females / Disabled / Veteran

Employees will be required to follow any other job-related instructions and to perform any other job-related duties requested by any person authorized to give instructions or assignments. title: Cybersecurity Analyst
description:
At MMGY, we believe nothing shapes your view of the world like travel. So every day, we share our client’s stories from a perspective that inspires people to see the world differently. We have an immediate opening for a Cybersecurity Analyst in our Overland Park, KS office. Primary responsibilities include working in collaboration with the Company’s Network Engineers to review the configuration of the computer networks to identify any potential vulnerabilities, install the necessary software in order to protect it from unauthorized access, and document detections so that future breaches can be mitigated efficiently. The Cybersecurity Analyst will defend the Company’s computer hardware, software and other systems from theft, loss and other cyberattacks.

  • Develop and maintain security guidelines, procedures, standards and controls documentation
  • Maintain a working knowledge of current cybercrime tactics
  • Constantly monitor for attacks and run appropriate defensive protocols if breaches occur
  • Implement security improvements by assessing the current situation; evaluating trends; anticipating requirements.


Required Skills & Experience
  • 2 - 3 years experience in Cybersecurity at a similar-sized business
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Cybersecurity or equivalent through a combination of education and work experience
  • Strong, fundamental knowledge of IT, including hardware, software, and networks

  • Responsibility and conscientiousness, including proper management of patches to defray business impact while keeping security protocols up-to-date

Who Are We? We’re a travel-obsessed collective of more than 600 people across the country and around the globe. And when we say we inspire people to go places, we mean ALL people. Computer network surveillance/monitoring.
Knowledge and understanding of (TCP/IP) protocols, network devices, multiple operating systems, and secure architectures.

Network traffic analysis.
  • Current experience with AWS security solutions and cloud security investigations

description:
